subject: Entrepreneurship
title: How Slack Pivoted From a Video Game
description: A fast breakdown of How Slack Pivoted From a Video Game for builders.

hook.text: Slack started as a video game called Glitch. The game flopped. The company nearly died.

buildup.text: While building Glitch, the team created an internal chat tool to coordinate across offices.

discovery.text: When Glitch failed, Stewart Butterfield noticed something: the team loved the chat tool more than the game.

twist.text: The tool nobody was supposed to see became the product. Butterfield pivoted the entire company around it.

climax.text: Slack reached a $1B valuation faster than any startup in historyâ€”just eight months after launch.

punchline.text: The side project was the real product all along.

quiz.question: What was Slack originally built as before its famous pivot?
options: A project management tool for remote teams
An internal communication tool for a video game company called Glitch
An email replacement for enterprise customers
